Update: I‚Äôm now on level 171. It requires me to get 10 striped candies in 12 moves. That‚Äôs ridiculous. I‚Äôve been on this level for days and I‚Äôve wasted boosters. I don‚Äôt see any way I‚Äôm ever going to pass this level unless I get incredibly lucky with the board. Please add more moves. The levels should be challenging  but they shouldn‚Äôt be near impossible.  -  It‚Äôs a fun game and a good way to pass time on the subway or waiting for an appointment. Overall I like it  I just have two suggestions: 1. Add an option to turn off hints. Most of the time they‚Äôre not actually helpful  but just a distraction. For example  every time there‚Äôs a color bomb on the board the game wants me to use it. Often times I‚Äôm saving the bomb for a later move but the game won‚Äôt stop telling me to use it now. 2. Add a confirmation for buying things with gold bars. Earlier today I failed a level and I accidentally pressed the button to pay for more moves. I wasted 10 bars. Just a simple ‚ÄúThis will cost 10 bars. Continue?‚Äù with a yes button and a cancel button would be helpful.

I love Candy Crush who doesn‚Äôt. But the game should be less addictive as it is. I played about 20 levels this morning and they were not easy. What I don‚Äôt like is that they only sometimes gives you boosts and such when you don‚Äôt to bribe you into the game. Something positive I should say is I love how the game is basically telling a story in candy land. The main character Tiff helps animals. I like that the challenges get harder as you go but not too hard that is good so you adapt and don‚Äôt notice how much harder they are compared from 80 to 1. And I like the contests because it‚Äôs fun to compete with people even if you don‚Äôt know them. I am really competitive so of course I do. I hate how they advertise other games by the company in the game because for their own sake people are going to stop playing cause of these adds. The gold bars are great when you have them but unfortunately they go away or spent very quickly that is. Thank you for reading  CatPenguin291 (Padfoot) fellow player.

Love this game! Been playing it since launch  and it gets better and better over time. This is game is simply  amazing without a doubt. However  I believe it can get even better! To improve upon this already great game  here are a few new features I believe many fans would appreciate being added to the game as an potential update sometime in the near future:  1. More choices for avatar customization - More hair styles and colors  - More skin tones - more facial features    a. character/trademark masks/costumes/etc.   b. more sizes/shapes/styles of noses  eyes  mouths  chin  ears  etc.   c. more body types     > heavy     > athletic      > skinny     > average      > other   d. ability to change your avatar‚Äôs height     > The ability to change your avatar‚Äôs battle team (maybe only once every 3 months or so) - Valor to Mystic/Instinct - Mystic to Valor/Instinct  - Instinct to Valor/Mystic 3. Ability to request/vote for the addition of new pok√©-stop and gym locations (most certainly in states/regions/cities/townships/rural areas where there really aren‚Äôt many pok√©-stop locations or gyms within walking distance of local residents) 4. Allowing players to view areas very far away from their current location  - ability to scroll and zoom in/out to view pok√©-stops and gyms in other states  providences  cities  and countries around the world   a. when viewing gyms outside a 2 mile radius of your current location:     > allow players the ability to view the Pok√©mon and their respective CP levels  current raid bosses/live timers  and the team who is currently in control of that gym     > allow players to send berries to to a damaged Pok√©mon from far away (maybe only one or a maximum of one berry/per day is allowed to be sent to a trainer‚Äôs Pok√©mon from far away similar to how special trades are allowed only once per day) 5. Ability to skip dialogue during research tasks 6. Ability to skip animations such as evolution animations  hatching egg animations  leveling up animations  and trading animations  etc.  7. Ability to chat      > w/ friends     > w/ other players during raid battles      > with a code for a online chatroom 8. etc.   These are a few features I‚Äôd like to see being added to the game and I can confirm that I‚Äôm not really the only person who wants these features to be added. There are many fans out there who are probably in agreement with me that many of the aforementioned features should be added to the game to make it more enjoyable than it is now.   Just a few suggestions to consider. No big deal if they aren‚Äôt added to the game  but it would be a bummer if they weren‚Äôt because many of my friends have told me they would very much like these suggestions to be considered and added as soon as possible. Nevertheless  still a fantastic game and I will continue to play it regardless of whether or not any more changes are made to the game. Lastly  I thank you for your time  and have a great rest of your day/night! Gotta catch ‚Äòem all!

This game had a rocky start. It was super popular and the servers couldn‚Äôt handle it. Now the developers push a new event almost all the time. Getting mew was fun and challenging(Ditto). Celebi and Spiritomb were arduous to obtain but Meltan has been extremely challenging because I don‚Äôt have a Nintendo switch. They have also pulled off some very awesome community days once a month where you get a similar ambiance to when the game first came out. Tons of people playing! They also used one of them to introduce a new mythical Pok√©mon in a very creative way.  I have enjoyed the new raid and research updates. We just need more ways to get silver pinaps.  Trading has been introduced to the game in a way that doesn‚Äôt ruin it and trading rare Pok√©mon with strangers is costly but with people you interact with daily it‚Äôs cheap.  The game is mostly free to play but I have personally spent some money on it. There was an egg event and I wanted more incubators. Anyways I wasn‚Äôt ever forced to buy anything and it isn‚Äôt like other apps where they throw sales in your face as pop ups every time you log in. You can earn 50 in game coins per day without paying a dime but that can be drastically easier or harder based on where you live.  In the past year this game has drastically changed into something truly addictive and fun to play. I can‚Äôt wait to see what they bring to the game next year.

column2: All these reviews are very often problems with people‚Äôs phones being old and they don‚Äôt know how to fix it. I have hardly had any of these problems playing with an iPhone 6s. If your service isn‚Äôt strong in a lot of areas  it could be hard to play because it does require significant data. Also  for those that say they make you pay money and it‚Äôs hard to get poke balls  very often they live in a backwoods area  I have never had much of a problem with this if I go out and spin poke stops for 20 minutes.  That being said  this is a wonderful game that has gotten me and my friends out of our houses and having a good time. The continuation of updates ever improve the game  whether it‚Äôs research tasks (which totally keeps me occupied) or trading. And for those that say they can‚Äôt find Pok√©mon? It‚Äôs a challenge! I need my Mega evolution. All of us are expecting this. I know you might be waiting for gen 6  but that is no excuse. We had Alolan Forms before gen 7. Also I would think it would be fun if we had 4 moves instead of 2. This is how it is in the games.

This game had a rocky start. It was super popular and the servers couldn‚Äôt handle it. Now the developers push a new event almost all the time. Getting mew was fun and challenging(Ditto). Celebi and Spiritomb were arduous to obtain but Meltan has been extremely challenging because I don‚Äôt have a Nintendo switch. They have also pulled off some very awesome community days once a month where you get a similar ambiance to when the game first came out. Tons of people playing! They also used one of them to introduce a new mythical Pok√©mon in a very creative way.  I have enjoyed the new raid and research updates. We just need more ways to get silver pinaps.  Trading has been introduced to the game in a way that doesn‚Äôt ruin it and trading rare Pok√©mon with strangers is costly but with people you interact with daily it‚Äôs cheap.  The game is mostly free to play but I have personally spent some money on it. There was an egg event and I wanted more incubators. Anyways I wasn‚Äôt ever forced to buy anything and it isn‚Äôt like other apps where they throw sales in your face as pop ups every time you log in. You can earn 50 in game coins per day without paying a dime but that can be drastically easier or harder based on where you live.  In the past year this game has drastically changed into something truly addictive and fun to play. I can‚Äôt wait to see what they bring to the game next year.

Wish Squad would appear again in some way.  So many more likely to get them then others. For instance I may live 1.5mile or 2mike a great place to catch them but can‚Äôt drive.  Others live in like Texas live so far away from water.  No one willing to trade because it cost so much.  Not just Squirtle Squad so much more raid than the birds and dogs others as well.

column2: I always had an it game angry birds Minecraft and when I was much younger Subway Surfers  I came across the game when I was only 5 or 6 when I was given my first devise from my parents for a Splendidly spent Christmas. It was a new  cheap  dark  Samsung Tablet. It was cheap  but very easy to use. I remember purchasing many apps  one of which a newly upgraded game called ‚ÄúSubway Surf‚Äù at least that‚Äôs what I thought it was dubbed until my mother corrected me weeks after. Once my mother told me the what I thought was a complicated game actually went around as ‚ÄúSubway surfers‚Äù I found this a tongue twister. ‚ÄúSubway suwfers‚Äù I would incorrectly call it.  4 YEARS PASSED I had lost my iPod. My sister newly had a phone and both tablets were cracked and outdated. I was in a new house and my room was what I would have thought was a mansion when I lived in my old tiny apartment home. I picked up my sisters iPod. It had not been used for years. I pressed in my sisters passcode and saw the app subway surfers  And that lead to me playing to this day!

I‚Äôve been an avid Subway Surfers aficionado for over five years and really disfavor the shorthand scoring tallies that this new version has created. Please let us see our true  full numerical totals again. At least somewhere in the game‚Äôs screens.   Sometimes  in a compulsion to seek change  you can forget the old adage that ‚Äòperfect is the enemy of good enough‚Äô.  We really have no need to see all of our scoring results on one screen  especially if they are truncated. I‚Äôve worked hard to amass my various totals...most particularly my coin total...and now have no idea of my actual results as you have blocked them from view. If I want to purchase more coins or keys  it motivates me far more to do so if I can see the full amounts in my account.   Perhaps if you insist on truncating these scores on the main page  could you still show the fully expanded totals elsewhere in the game?  Thank you for reading this review.  Bill Chiang Mai  Thailand

Great game very great energy as long as you join the right clan the concept isn‚Äôt at all unique but the twist to the concept of a strategic base building game done by supercell make it unique within itself and that aspect draws my attention although the game is very fun and challenging in many forms it‚Äôs still proposes as a very time consuming game it is almost as if it too strongly encourages the spending factor to create in a sense a pay to win type of game but even then the ranking system makes for a good balance to counteract that point of focus I do in fact wish times for upgrades were shortened but it would not make the game a strive for success as much as it does the way it is approached now but overall this game is fun  delightful to play with friends  very very strategic  and also easy to use and I enjoy the gameplay despite the flaws but you know what good game doesn‚Äôt have its kinks to work out and supercell does a great job of listening and working on all problems to further increase the gameplay in itself!üòá

Some times when you find success you're better off sticking with your core principles rather than trying to redesign/reinvent yourself and supercell unfortunately has fallen victim to their own success.  The game is nothing like it was in the beginning and unfortunately for supercell the majority of the people who also were there in the beginning long left this game for greener pastures and took their $$ with them.  I too spent quite a bit but haven't in 5 years and won't ever again.  The game now is just too gimmicky and convoluted for its own good.  The appeal for me once upon a time was the game mimicked real life where if you worked hard and saved you could build a strong defense and that was enough but now this everyone gets a trophy at the expense of the more powerful attitude has destroyed that. What's the point of saving up or buying strong walls if someone with a level one potion just jumps right over them or knocks them down?

But there is one issue  you have to grind for a long time with no way to speed up the process unless you want to pay to by resources so you don‚Äôt have to wait for your collectors. Or maybe even just skip the whole process by buying gems. Besides that fact it is a amazing game if your bored or just need a pass time. Because of all these facts I give it a 4/5.

This is a very fun game  & can be quite addictive  especially if you have an active & fun clan.    But the support from Supercell is perhaps the worst I have ever seen from any large app or gaming company. Yes  they will respond quickly... but they respond with worthless dribble. They knowingly allow people to cheat or abuse holes in the system that creates unfair gameplay which is also not fun. The don‚Äôt allow for the dynamic changes that can happen over years of play  such as allowing clan name changes or helping restore a clan when the only leader of the clan disappears permanently leaving all the other active players hanging in the lurch. Could they fix these things? Yes. But they chose not to & instead only focus on ways to make more money for their bottom line. Ironically  they would get a lot more of my money like they did in the early days if they would step up & be more helpful.

This is a game you can play both casually and competitively which is great. The community aspects that being in a clan  offer are great if you and friends are looking for an app to play together. The strategy elements bring back fond memories of this base building army training genre and have enough depth to let you experiment and enjoy yourself  yet not so much that you cant just train whatever and throw it at a base when you don't feel like going all in lol  This is one of the survivors from generation to generation of iPhone updates for a reason. Its a classic  and if you play games in your free time  enjoy strategic gameplay  or need a game to play with your friends  this app should be installed on your phone.  Another thing id like to say is that people who salt over the night village are off track.  Its more competitive in my opinion - so while i recommend trying to use it  if you don't want to play competitively then don't feel pressured to go to that island.   This island does struggle from an artificially slow progression system and honestly idk how to fix that. Only being able to (for free) collect a certain amount of loot from battles a day makes it very hard to feel like your making progress. Id love to see you get *something* out of fighting more than the three battles for daily bonuses. Flaws aside the new buildings  training mechanics  troops  and battle style (of real time vs battles) are awesome and breath strategic life into the game. It provides a platform to improve your attack strategies in. You can rush your base as long as your a god at attacking - it makes the gap between free to play players and maxed bases less impactful because a good attack wins can win you the game against better defenses  and you cant buy skilled attacking  its something you practice.

I've played the game for over 5 yrs. On the surface  Clash of Clans in an excellent mobile game that I would recommend to any casual gamer who is excited to drop their first wizard tower  hero  and/or inferno tower on the map! Where this game falls grossly short is in its customer service and pay-to-win/progress development cycle for the experienced player base. There is a rich history of dishonest press releases and customer support emails filled with friendly language offering no help to the customer (unless that customer is having trouble spending their money on Clash of Clans content). These issues easily reduce what would be a 5-star game to the 3-star rating provided. If you are competetive or a completionist  avoid this game as it is designed to extract large amounts of money from these players and the return on investment is not even close to what other titles offer for your time and finicial investment.
column5: Solid game  poor customer support  dishonest developer

This Solitaire game has been around since my very first iPhone. MobilityWare has been in this realm a long time  so their apps are very very good. Gameplay is smooth and has many customizable settings and options.  My only complaint (albeit a small one) is the way these ad-supported games work. They just blast you with ads. Game completion  game restart  new game  etc....all trigger ads. I understand the model they have to work from to generate revenue  but it seems like there could be fewer and still show the appropriate number of ads to generate income from users. The problem is with so many options to pick from  and Solitaire being a game that's identical from one developer to another  is that the next game that has less or no ads will be the one people move to. That said  hopefully MW can tone it down some and make the overall gameplay experience less interrupted and distracting  ....it's an otherwise great execution to a fun game.

The game is good  but would be better with less abusive tactics.  Why do I use the strong word "abusive"? Well  closing one ad and it immediately re-opening isn't changing my mind about downloading it.  Also  If I closed your pop up ad for the last game a few seconds ago  do you think I will change my mind if you harass me? I will NEVER download a nag ad! Stop harassing me. If this happens to you  use the support link (tap the cog settings icon  and then the ‚Äúprofile‚Äù button  then the support link in the bottom right corner) because this will create a message with data about your individual game at the end. Normally  I like FN quite a bit‚Äî I dislike the amount of ads  especially for pharmaceuticals  and that certain content is paid-exclusive‚Äî but lately I‚Äôve spent more time communicating with Mads and the support team than playing. Let me get this out of the way- this game is actually pretty decent. But  if you are looking at the reviews to see if you should download the game or not- strap in for a middle school sized essay. The first thing I would change about this game is the main menu and how you unlock modes. When I first started on this game  I thought that I would get every mode at the start of the game  but I had to unlock all of them  (except classic) and that led to me being extremely frustrated and took me about a month to unlock all of the modes. It explains everything in the description of the app  including how to play the modes  but failed to mention how long it takes you to unlock all of these modes. And every mode (except classic  arcade  and zen) were epic fails. When you unlock another mode  a message of ‚Äù THIS MODE IS CRAPPY  SUCKER ‚Äù should appear. The second thing I would change is  get rid of the fruit fact saying that apple seeds are poisonous. When I was little and I played this game (I was like 5) I was very close to not eating apples  but my mom told me the truth. And I think that this game appeals to younger kids  and apples might be the only healthy thing they eat. Other than that  home run! Good job developers!

column2: Overall this is a fun game. I like the powers of the blades and the different dojos. However  while I have only one gripe with this game  it is a pretty major one. When using any blade other than the original blade (the one you start off with)  the blade animations begin to gradually appear on the screen as you play the round. For example if I were using the pixel blade  more and more pixels would appear on my screen. And once the round ends  when you‚Äôve hit a bomb or dropped too many fruit or whatever  the animations don‚Äôt go away. They‚Äôre there for every single game you play after that  and the only way I‚Äôve found to get rid of them is by closing the window. The animations block your view of the fruit and make it really hard to avoid hitting bombs. Why is this feature there? Is it a glitch? I find this annoying and unnecessary and I hope it is removed as soon as possible.

Seeing as it is now $15  you can imagine how mad I was that it disappeared when I deleted the app  as did all my progress. The menu layout is also way too much and way too complex for a game this simple  and it‚Äôs all because of micro-transactions pushing. Some people are okay with this  and if you are one of them then you would really like Fruit Ninja. Meanwhile  I have already uninstalled the game.

I started playing fruit ninja to pass the time ages ago and haven't stopped since.

The basic modes (classic  arcade  and zen) are really fun the the update has some issues  especially with the mini games. The mini games are WAY too expensive and you don't get many golden apples from them. And the app keeps crashing. One time I spent 300 star fruit on a mini game and it crashed and didn't give me my starfruit nor any golden apples. If I knew that would have happened I wouldn't have spent my starfruit. As with the tournament  it's nearly impossible to win because when you mix the two different colors of fruit and a bunch of bombs  you can't get any points because you'll hit the opponent's fruits which will give THEM points or you'll hit a bomb which makes you lose even more. But it you just leave the fruit to fall you'll most likely lose the game. And that makes it really frustrating because the computer can easily be programmed to swipe only the red fruit and nothing else.  The newest Halloween update is great but in the free dojo it's nearly impossible to get any candy and in the other ones you have to pay golden apples  which is an issue because of the mini games.   I know this review turned out to be really long but these problems are really frustrating. If they were fixed overall it would be a great game!
